results.title: Milk and beef
results.creator_credit: W. Hugh Baddeley and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a coverage of the milk and beef industries in England, from the grazing of cattle to the production of meat, dairy products and leather. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Milk [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mairi Cameron, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A tenuous friendship is formed between a reclusive older gentleman (Arthur Dignam) and his younger neighbour downstairs (Kris McQuade), with milk providing the fragile link between them.

results.title: Mildura fruit flyer
results.brief_description: A vital link between the fruit growers of Mildura and the markets in Melbourne. In less than 24 hours fruit is picked, sorted, packed and transported by road to the rail yeards, where it is loaded into rail trucks for its express trip to the city markets.
results.description: A vital link between the fruit growers of Mildura and the markets in Melbourne. In less than 24 hours fruit is picked, sorted, packed and transported by road to the rail yeards, where it is loaded into rail trucks for its express trip to the city markets.

results.title: Mikhali
results.creator_credit: John Ingram, Humphrey Swingler, British Petroleum, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: A young officer in the Greek Merchant Navy returns to his home on the island of Skiathos to marry his betrothed. Nikos has not seen Maria since she was a rather unattractive teenager, and does not know she has blossomed into the island’s prettiest young woman. Their meeting and the ensuing wedding preparations make a delightful story, superbly photographed in the romantic Greek Islands. Narrated in English, with Greek dialogue.

results.title: Mike van Diem's character
results.brief_description: Following the death of ruthless baliff Dreverhaven, Jakob, a young lawyer is arrested for his murder. During interrogation he reveals the victim is his father and through a series of flashbacks tells the story of a boy who feels rejected by his family. Based on the novel by Ferdinand Bordewijk. In Dutch with English subtitles.

results.title: Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: An iconographic film using the pictures and text of Virginia Lee Burton’s story of the steam shovel that defied obsolescence by becoming the furnace in the Popperville Town Hall. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Miguel: up from Puerto Rico
results.creator_credit: Bert Salzman and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Miguel, a Puerto Rican American who loses the dollar for his father’s birthday dinner fish. Recalling how he and his father used to fish in Puerto Rico, Miguel tries the city river without success. As he goes home the fishseller hires him to translate for Spanish-speaking customers and Miguel learns the advantages of biculturalism.

results.title: Migration: the decision to migrate (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: The first of a three part program which traces a Finnish family from its initial decision to emigrate to Australia, probes their reactions to living in Australia, and finally explains why the family prepare to return to Finland after 18 months in Australia. This filmed interview looks at the lifestyle of the family in Finland and their reasons for migrating. Their reasons range from undisclosed personal considerations to the feeling that personal freedom and initiative have declined in Finland and that life in Australia will provide better opportunities for their children.
